SENT.plain: Down syndrome is the most common chromosomal abnormality
A simultaneous occurrence with Marfan syndrome is extremely rare
We present a case of a 28-year-old female with Down syndrome and a mutation in the fibrillin-1 gene
The patient showed strikingly few manifestations of Marfan syndrome
Although variable expression is known to be present in Marfan syndrome, phenotypic expression of Marfan syndrome in our patient might be masked by the co-occurrence of Down syndrome
